title: Manchester City would reject £450m bids for Phil Foden, insists Pep Guardiola
text:
Phil Foden is yet to start a Premier League match this term (Picture: Getty)

Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola says Phil Foden is being groomed to step into David Silva’s boots next season and the club wouldn’t listen to any offers for the midfielder.

The Spaniard’s use of Foden has drawn criticism from some quarters with the 19-year-old making just one Premier League appearance so far this term.

Foden signed a new six-year deal with City earlier this year and Metro.co.uk recently revealed that Guardiola blocked the midfielder from leaving on loan.

David Silva is set to leave the club at the end of the season and Guardiola says Foden will replace the Spaniard.

Foden is being lined up to replace Silva next season (Picture: Getty)

‘We didn’t give Foden a new contract by accident,’ said Guardiola.

‘He is the only player that can’t be sold under any circumstances — the only one. Not even for 500m euros.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Phil’s going nowhere — Phil IS City. We won’t be signing anyone else for that position.

‘When David Silva leaves, we know exactly who our new magician will be’.

Guardiola was criticised for Jadon Sancho’s departure to Dortmund with many claiming he should have given the winger more opportunities at the club.

However, Guardiola feels that in Foden City have a player that can be ‘one of the best’ in the league.

‘He’s grown up with us. He’s one of us and he’s going to be brilliant — one of the Premier League’s best.”

‘One thing is clear, Foden has a place in City’s first team.

‘I’d be interested to see if a different manager would have given him his chance to develop, or loaned him out.

‘I don’t like leaving him out of certain games but must think of the whole squad. Phil understands that.’
